alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 03 at 11:56PM CST until January 04 at 12:30AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Choctaw County in southwestern Alabama... Northern Washington County in southwestern Alabama... Northwestern Clarke County in southwestern Alabama... Southeastern Wayne County in southeastern Mississippi... Northern Greene County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 1230 AM CST. * At 1156 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles east of Waynesboro to Buckatunna to 12 miles southwest of State Line to 5 miles north of McLain, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Chatom, Saint Stephens, Tibbie, Millry, State Line, Buckatunna, Silas, Fruitdale and Coffeeville. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for southwestern Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for southwestern Alabama.
